item.title: 7 Classic Nintendo Duos That Need An RPG Like Mario & Luigi Brothership
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Mario & Luigi RPG series started in 2003 with unique duo gameplay that uses A & B buttons for each character.
  • Other classic duos like Wario & Waluigi, Diddy & Dixie, and Link & Zelda could work well in similar RPG spinoffs.
  • Active RPG combat systems can be adapted to different Nintendo duos, providing new gameplay opportunities for characters like Jesse & James.

The Mario & Luigi RPG series began on the Game Boy Advance in 2003. It was the third attempt at making an RPG franchise starring Mario and the first to give Luigi a co-starring role. What set the first game, Mario & Luigi: Superstar Saga , apart from the previous RPGs was that each character was controlled by a single button whether in battle or in traversal mode.

Mario was mapped to A while Luigi had the B button. The formula could work so well with other classic duos in Nintendo franchises for an RPG spinoff. All they need are a few ideas to get the ball rolling, so here they are.

7 Wario & Waluigi

The Opposite Side Of Mario & Luigi

Wario and Waluigi have never starred in a game together outside all of the Mario sports titles. Wario has certainly starred in a bunch of non-sports titles but Waluigi hasn’t. An otherworldly version of the Mario & Luigi RPGs but with antagonists could work well as Nintendo could go wild with the characters.

When AlphaDream was still developing the series, they attempted something like this via the third game, Mario & Luigi: Bowser’s Inside Story , making Bowser the co-lead. This idea is too good to pass up so whether Wario and Waluigi co-star in an RPG, a platformer, an RTS, and so on, the characters deserve more.

6 Diddy Kong & Dixie Kong

An Ape Escape

Donkey Kong and Diddy Kong became partners when Donkey Kong Country was released on the SNES. Every Donkey Kong Country sequel following that on the SNES had two different leads like Diddy was joined by his cousin Dixie in Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddy's Kong Quest . That pairing would work the best for an RPG spinoff as it would give players of different mindsets someone to root for.

Maybe the RPG could have Diddy and Dixie try to rescue Donkey Kong as they did in Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddy's Kong Quest . It would also be interesting if the RPG could incorporate the various mounts from the series into battle or traversal like Rambi the Rhino.

5 Link & Zelda

2/3 Of The Triforce

Link and Zelda have not worked together in many games so much as they have been love interests. Also, Zelda has typically been a literal damsel in distress for players to rescue. With the release of The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom , it seems like Nintendo is more open to allowing Zelda to be a playable lead. The opening of The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom even has the two characters exploring with each other, teasing fans about what could be.

Whether Nintendo chooses an already-established universe or creates a new one, the active RPG combat system of Mario & Luigi would work well in Hyrule. To bounce off of Mario & Luigi: Brothership specifically, a sailing RPG set in the world of The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker would be fun as Tetra seems the most capable out of all the versions of Zelda.

4 Jesse & James

Prepare For Trouble And Make It Double

Jesse and James were created for the Pokemon anime and they are two members of Team Rocket. They did appear in Pokemon Yellow though which tried to add things from the show. Now, the anime had the two villains try and steal Pikachu from Ash and various other Pokemon in nearly every episode. They’re fun villains to hate on even though they do seemingly have good qualities underneath too.

Good qualities that could be likened to Wario or even Bowser, making Jesse and James the perfect unlikely stars for a Pokemon spinoff. The Pokemon series are already turn-based RPGs and they feature the titular monsters as party members. So, giving that battle role to Jesse and James would be odd but there are ways to make it feel less weird. Jesse and James could command Pokemon in RTS or tactical battles with active elements like in the Mario & Luigi games, for example.

3 Fox & Falco

Do A Barrel Roll

Technically, the Star Fox series hasn’t had a new game since 2017 via Star Fox 2 . That was based on a canceled SNES game though, so the last real entry was 2016’s Star Fox Zero . Now, most entries in the series have been aerial space shooters but there have been spinoffs into other genres like platformers and RTS games.

Also, the star, Fox, doesn’t just have one partner in the series, he has three via Slippy, Falco, and Peppy. Of those three, it would make the most sense to pair Fox with Falco in a buddy-buddy RPG. They butt heads in the series, giving the characters room to grow as they have to work together in this proposed RPG.

2 Callie & Marie

Pop Idols Under The Sea

Post-apocalyptic games exploded in the late 2000s and the genre is seemingly here to stay. Nintendo doesn’t have a lot of post-apocalyptic exclusives under their belt save for the Splatoon games. The theory goes that humanity was wiped out and fish mutated into anthropomorphic beings who now live in old human societies like Japan. That’s why the squid-like Inklings have a lot of Japanese customs like their worshiping of pop idols.

In every game, there is a pop group set up as broadcasters to give players the lay of the land. Callie and Marie were in the first game, Pearl and Marina were the stars in Splatoon 2, and Shiver, Big Man, and Frye were the idols of Splatoon 3 . Basing an RPG on any of these groups would be interesting like a collage between Tokyo Mirage Sessions #FE , The World Ends With You , and Mario & Luigi . That said, Callie and Marie, as the OG pop idols, deserve the role the most.

1 Little Mac & Doc Louis

Join The Nintendo Fun Club Today!

Little Mac is the hero in most of the Punch-Out games but he is aided by his coach, Doc Louis. Sometimes Doc has good advice while other times his lines are silly like telling Little Mac about the advantages of joining the Nintendo Fun Club. The Punch-Out series has been dead since the Wii game launched in 2009 unfortunately.

While fans may want a pure sequel of boxing mayhem, that may not be enough to sell copies anymore. Instead, the sequel or spinoff could take on an RPG system wherein Doc will help Little Mac train in turned-based battles around the city. Big boss battles could be classic Punch-Out stylized boxing matches then as Little Mac makes his way to the top.

item.title: Roblox: Anime Reborn Codes (November 2024)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Anime Reborn Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes for Anime Reborn
  • How to Get More Anime Reborn Codes

Anime tower defense games have become extremely popular on Roblox as of late, as evidenced by the success of Anime Reborn . Released in late 2024, the game quickly rose to the top of the best experiences list, with hundreds of thousands of people taking the time to check it out.

The game provides Roblox players with numerous rewards just for playing, although those looking to get their hands on some extra Gems can do so by using Anime Reborn codes. This guide contains all of the latest codes for Anime Reborn , as well as information on how players can redeem them.

All Anime Reborn Codes

All Working Anime Reborn Codes

  • 200kMembers - Redeem code for 500 Gems, 2 Potential Keys, and 2 Trait Crystals (NEW)
  • 1MVisits - Redeem code for 1,000 Gems, 2 Potential Keys, and 5 Trait Crystals (NEW)
  • Release - Redeem code for 500 Gems and 2 Trait Crystals​​​​​​​ (NEW)
  • MozKing - Redeem code for 250 Gems and 1 Trait Crystal​​​​​​​ (NEW)
  • SubtoRlxsage - Redeem code for 250 Gems and 1 Trait Crystal​​​​​​​ (NEW)
  • SubtoZillas - Redeem code for 250 Gems and 1 Trait Crystal​​​​​​​ (NEW)

All Expired Anime Reborn Codes

  • There are currently no expired Anime Reborn codes.

How to Redeem Codes for Anime Reborn

The process for redeeming Anime Reborn codes should be relatively straightforward for most players, especially those who've redeemed codes in other Roblox games. However, for anybody having trouble, the following step-by-step instructions should prove useful, as too should the video at the top of the page.

  1. Launch Anime Reborn on Roblox .
  2. In the hub world, find the REDEEM CODES! area, which features a glowing blue circle and Luffy sitting on a blue treasure chest.
  3. After interacting with Luffy to open the Codes menu, type or paste one of the working Anime Reborn codes into the "Enter code..." box and then click the green "Redeem" button.

How to Get More Anime Reborn Codes

The best place to get more codes for Anime Reborn is right here, as we're always on the lookout and will add any that we find to the list above. However, players may also want to keep an eye on the developer's socials and the game's official Discord server, as Roblox promo codes are sometimes released in these places as well.

  • Anime Reborn Roblox Group
  • Anime Reborn Discord Server
  • @RealMozKIng Twitter Account
  • @RlxSage Twitter Account
  • @RealZillas Twitter Account

item.title: 8 Horror Games That Feature Co-Op Without Sacrificing Tension
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Horror games thrive on player isolation, making single-player experiences ideal to capitalize on loneliness.
  • Some horror games still manage to instill dread and fear even when played with friends due to eerie locations and masterful sound design.
  • Multiplayer horror games like Dead by Daylight and The Outlast Trials offer terrifying experiences with teamwork required to survive.

Horror games often thrive when the player truly feels isolated from others, as when people are alone, they are also more vulnerable. Because of this, most horror games are single-player experiences to take advantage of the player's loneliness, with only horrid creatures and creeping dread to keep them company.

Horror games that can still evoke dread, tension, and fear even when playing with friends are a true testament to the developers' skill in crafting a truly horrifying experience. Eerie locations, masterful sound design, and a terrifying ambiance can still hold players in an icy grip of horror even when they are in the company of others.

8 Dead By Daylight

Certain Killers On The Roster Are Nothing Short Of Terrifying

There is no other game in the world where gplayersamers can flee the Demogorgon from Stranger Things while playing as Resident Evil's Jill Valentine and teaming up with Nicolas Cage. This is the major key to Dead by Daylight's success, as their killer and survivor rosters are both brimming with licensed characters from iconic horror IPs.

As an asymmetrical horror game, those who play as survivors either team up with friends or other random players to try and survive the trials ahead of them. They must repair generators while avoiding the grasp of the killer to escape through the exit gates or hatch. While Dead by Daylight is closer to a party game than a horror game, there are still times the killer will terrify the wits out of the survivor, be it because of their sudden, stealthy appearance, or because of which killer they are facing. There are few things more terrifying than being chased around by the Xenomorph, for example, or the scratched mirror Michael Myers who completely eliminates all warnings that he is near, leaving players stuck in a smothering limbo of suspense.

7 Escape The Backrooms

Explore The Eerie And Fabled Backrooms With Friends

Originating from 4chan of all places, The Backrooms became one of the most famed fictional places of modern times. It comprises multiple different settings, but yellow wallpaper and damp carpet are the bread and butter of this liminal space. Any who enter The Backrooms are said to do so by accident, clipping through the fabric of reality to end up in this alternate realm. It is also said that any who fall in here may face the dangerous entities that call this place home.

Escape the Backrooms takes place in this fictional setting, where up to four friends need to survive The Backrooms and find a way to return home. Drenched in an eerie, spine-tingling ambiance, players need to keep their wits about them and listen for any dreaded sound that breaks the silence, other than the sound of their friends. With a total of 12 entities in the game, players never know what to expect, which only makes encounters more frightening.

6 Resident Evil: Revelations 2

Work Together To Survive The Horror

Resident Evil is normally a single-player affair, with one person facing the survival horror alone, solving puzzles, exploring a location, and killing their fair share of horrid, mutated creatures inflicted with one Umbrella Corp. virus or another. Resident Evil 5 began the series' short tryst with co-op gameplay, specifically designing the game with the idea that it would not be played as a solo experience with its underwhelming AI partner.

Resident Evil 6 continued that trend, and then it was also implemented in Resident Evil: Revelations 2 . The first entry brought the game back to its isolated, claustrophobic horror roots, which was continued in the episodic sequel. The dual storylines connect Claire and Moira's captivity on the island, along with Barry searching for his missing daughter. Teamwork is the aim of the game here, but it does little to dispel the tension of the eerie locations, which definitely feel haunted. It won't be ghosts that players are facing though, just classic mutated creatures that were maybe once human and are absolutely terrifying. Even as a team, these creatures can still induce plenty of scares, and the scenery plenty of tension.

5 The Outlast Trials

Avoid Psychosis Or Witness The Skinner Man

Outlast began its run as a single-player survival horror experience, taking players first to an abandoned asylum, and then to a rural farming village in the sequel. With the gaming industry placing a large emphasis on multiplayer, it came as no surprise when Outlast tapped into this market, resulting in The Outlast Trials , a four-person horror co-op experience.

Playing as alleged "volunteers" for new methods of brainwashing and mind control masquerading as therapy, players must complete various trials that involve different locations and objectives to earn their freedom. The catch is that there are plenty of enemies standing between the players and their objectives that are undeniably terrifying. By far the most frightening enemy is the Skinner Man, a hallucination brought on when a player's sanity drops to zero. Psychosis is not only a dangerous state to be in but calls forward an entity that is nothing short of nightmare-inducing.

4 Lethal Company

Encounter Hostile Creatures While Salvaging

A fun game designed with multiplayer in mind, Lethal Company tasks up to four players to travel to different planets and search for salvage to bring back to The Company to reach their mandatory quota. Failure to meet the quota in the time given will result in them being fired...straight out of an airlock.

If the horrors of dystopian capitalism weren't enough, players also come face to face with all manner of hostile alien life while searching the buildings on each planet for valuable scrap. These places are more often than not dark and maze-like, which can make fleeing to safety doubly hard. Despite often being seen as a silly little game to enjoy with friends, Lethal Company packs a surprisingly scary punch with its monster design, which includes large spiders, a creepy ghost girl, and the coil head, all of which are uniquely terrifying.

3 The Texas Chainsaw Massacre

Based On The Iconic Slasher Movie

Another asymmetrical multiplayer horror game many thought might finally dethrone Dead by Daylight, The Texas Chainsaw Massacre is based on the movie of the same name. Three players will control a member of the Sawyer family, including Bubba, and four will play the unfortunate victims who have found themselves in the family's crosshairs, starting out locked away in a basement that they must escape.

From the moment a match loads, the atmosphere of dread immediately sets in. The victims are more or less hopeless against the Sawyer family, as they have very few means to defend themselves. The best they can do is try to keep as quiet as possible, but certain actions they must take to escape will generate noise and alert the family.

2 Phasmophobia

Hunt Ghosts While Avoiding Becoming A Part Of Their Undead Legion

Those looking for something more in the paranormal vein should definitely check out Phasmophobia , as it might just be the scariest ghost game on the market. Playing as a group of drastically underpaid paranormal investigators, the team will journey to their chosen location armed with as much equipment as they can afford. They must then cycle through their equipment to see what triggers a response to narrow down which entity is haunting the premises.

There is a slew of possible entities that require thorough investigation and a lot of courage to identify. The locations players travel to are always derelict and dark, creating the perfect atmosphere to terrify players. The activities of the ghosts can also be startling, especially when they go into hunt mode, and might just end up killing one of the unfortunate players in their path. With the addition of VR compatibility, Phasmophobia never relents with its oppressive atmosphere and haunting terror.

1 The Dark Pictures Anthology

A Narrative Series That Players Can Influence Together

From Until Dawn fame, the studio Supermassive Games went on to create more immersive choice-based horror games, collectively known as The Dark Pictures Anthology . The first season began with Man of Medan and concluded with The Devil in Me , comprised of four scary games in total, each with its own smart twist that completely alters the storyline. Though these games are great to play solo, there is also the option to play with friends locally or online.

How this works is that they will control a different character on the screen, and will be tasked with making that character's decisions. This can create moments of tension or chaos, particularly in Man of Medan when the characters suffer hallucinations to make it impossible to determine friend from foe. Intricate, well-crafted storylines and plenty of scares make these games fantastic, and the feeling of dread never relents, even in multiplayer.

item.title: StarCraft 2: 9 Tips For Playing Zerg
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Never Too Many Workers
  • Overlord Surveillance
  • Double Evolution Chambers & Spires
  • Speed Is King
  • Build Many Hatcheries
  • Hide Additional Structures
  • Queens Spawning Larvae
  • Mutate Some Overseers
  • Spread Creep

Key Takeaways

  • Always maximize Larvae production for quick unit building.
  • Spread Creep to control the map and speed up your own units.
  • Maintain speed and hit-and-run strategies for Zerg advantage.

The Zerg can be a fairly complicated race to play in StarCraft 2 , as their mechanics are much more alien than even the Protoss. Everything in the Zerg Swarm is living, including the buildings, so the various buildings you need to make throughout the game aren't just built by a worker who then moves on to the next task.

While the Zerg can be complicated to learn, they have a lot of mechanics that can make them much stronger than the other two factions, you just need to know how to play them properly. Here are some tips on how to play Zerg in StarCraft 2 .

Never Too Many Workers

Keep Building & Never Lose Speed

  • Always be fully saturated for minerals.
  • Replace used workers immediately.

To create a building as the Zerg, you'll need to use a worker and have them morph into that structure. On top of farming minerals and gas, this means you'll be going through a lot of workers throughout the game, and you'll need to stay on top of your income while still getting new structures to build new units.

You'll often want a Hatchery to be fully saturated, meaning the maximum number of workers are currently active and farming. This will lead to less of a noticeable change in your income if you need to build multiple buildings at once, though it's important to quickly replace any used workers as the number of buildings you need will only increase.

Overlord Surveillance

Free Early-Game Recon

  • Place Overlords on high ground to keep them safe.
  • Prioritize the speed boost.

Overlords give you more control points when built, but can move around in the air like any other creature. During the early stages of the game, send your first few Overlords to the other side of the map to get information, while setting them up along the path to your base to know of any attacks before they get to you.

You can also get their speed upgrade, Pneumatized Carapace at any Hatchery for 100 Minerals and 100 Gas, which can make them much better at scouting and escaping should they be caught.

Double Evolution Chambers & Spires

Upgrade Your Army's Base Stats Fast

  • Always get the carapace upgrade first since it affects all ground units.
  • Always have upgrades in progress.

The Zerg are always trying to evolve and get stronger, and the same is true in any battle. An Evolution Chamber and Spire can only upgrade one option at a time, so it's best to get two of each to upgrade your armies' attack and defense at the same time.

Evolution Chambers have three upgrades, and if you have a well-balanced army, you may want to consider three Chambers to make sure you keep up with if not dominate an enemy in terms of upgrades, even if the Zerg don't have the same futuristic weapons. The cost of these upgrades all at once may be high, but the differences you'll see in combat make them well worth the effort.

Speed Is King

Hit & Run Strategies That Start Early

  • Try outmaneuvering enemies instead of fighting them head-on.
  • Buy any speed upgrade when possible.

The Zerg have many fast units and many that can upgrade their speed. Zerglings with the speed upgrade completed in the Spawning Pool have the highest base movement of anything in the game, and that is also one of the best upgrades you should get right away in any game.

While individual Zerg units may not have the highest stats, use speed to your advantage to hit the enemy in different sections of the map before quickly repositioning and being ready to defend against a counter-attack or take advantage of an opening. The best openings will usually see a squad of Zerglings with the speed boost running past your opponent's army to reach the workers at a nearby base, who they can make very short work of.

Build Many Hatcheries

Dominate The Economy

  • Maximize the number of available Larvae.
  • Collect all the resources possible before the enemy can get to them.

Larva are generated from Hatcheries and are the backbone of your success. The Zerg tend to move quickly when played right, and that will require a lot of resources on top of a lot of Larva. You'll want to quickly get a second Hatchery within the first two minutes of a game, and aim for a third at least by minute three or four.

Having multiple Hatcheries that are fully saturated will greatly help you have the resources to mass produce entire armies in seconds. The resources of any map are limited and quickly taking them before your opponent can help cut their legs out during the later stages of a game if it lasts that long.

Hide Additional Structures

Never Slow Your Troop Production

  • Also hide an additional Lair or Hive.
  • Have two of every building towards the middle of a game.

As long as you have one structure built anywhere, Larva from any Hatchery can morph into the units unlocked from that structure. While it's best to have the majority of your structures around your main base where they are safest, it's always a good idea to have a backup somewhere else on the map.

Should you lose your main base and lose all your structures, you'll have to go through the entire structure tree again to get late-game units. Having an additional backup of every structure somewhere on the map can let you lose your entire home base and not skip a beat in making more units.

Queens Spawning Larvae

Seemingly Infinite Larvae To Use When Needed

  • Queen's get enough energy to constantly use Spawn Larvae.
  • Only one set of Larvae from Spawn Larvae can be growing at a time.

Every Hatchery you have should also have a Queen standing nearby using the Spawn Larva ability every chance they can. Spawn Larva places three additional larva eggs on a Hatchery that will hatch and allow you to go beyond the usual limit of Larvae. A Hatchery only produces three Larvae before it stops and waits for them to be morphed.

Using the Spawn Larvae ability, you can go beyond the limit, and give a Hatchery an infinite amount of Larvae. By letting this stack up throughout the game on multiple Hatcheries, you can get to a point where you spawn an entire army in the time it takes to spawn a single unit, you just have to stay on top of spawning larvae on every Hatchery throughout the game.

Mutate Some Overseers

Better Late Game Recon

  • Overseers can spot invisible enemies.
  • Changelings can hide within enemy armies if not spotted.

As a game progresses, Overlords won't stay the best option for surveillance but can be morphed into an Overseer once you have a Lair. Overseers naturally move faster making it harder to shoot them down with a single marine, and also have the Recon ability which lets them see invisible units.

The Overseer also has the Changling ability, which creates a harmless Changling that approaches an enemy and morphs into their basic unit. If the enemy has Recon, they will spot and kill the unit, or a skilled player can do the same, though a CHangling is often a great way to walk among your enemy and see what they are doing with less fear of being noticed.

Spread Creep

Control The Entire Map

  • Speed up your own units even more.
  • Place Spine and Spore Crawlers throughout the map to constantly harass enemies.

Creep spreads from Hatcheries but can also be spread with the Spawn Creep Tumor ability from any Queen. Once a Creep Tumor has been placed, another Tumor can spread from that Tumor onto ground already covered by Creep, but giving a new center to spread from.

Creep makes your units move faster, and lets you build structures anywhere, while also giving you vision of any area covered in Creep. Your goal for every game should be placing a few Creep Tumors and trying to get them to spread across the entire map. Enemy factions that aren't Zerg also can't built on Creep, so you can also cut off expansion points, which are a crucial aspect of such a difficult game, using something that is completely free to use.

item.title: Monster Hunter Rise: Apex Monsters, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Apex Monsters in Monster Hunter: Rise are powerful rivals, with unique traits and abilities, adding greater challenge to the game.
  • Each Apex monster variant, like Apex Arzuros and Apex Rathalos, exhibits enhanced powers and deadly new attacks against players.
  • Apex Zinogre stands out as the strongest of all Apex Monsters, showcasing unmatched electrical prowess and aggression in battle.

The Monster Hunter s eries is not shy from introducing whacky new monster types and mechanics to the game's core meta. In most main series additions to the franchise, new variants, types, and classes of monsters have been introduced in some capacity. Consequently, in the Monster Hunter: Rise games, Apex Monsters was introduced as one of its core features to make it distinguishable from other games in the franchise.

Apex Monsters are unique beasts, the pack leader among adversaries, attacking hunters, villages, and settlements. These creatures are immensely powerful, surviving the harsh environment of Monster Hunter to lament themselves at the top of the pecking order in power and strength.

6 Apex Arzuros

Razor-Sharp Claws, Relentless Rage Bear

Monster Class

Elements

Weakness

Fanged Beast

Water, Ice

Fire, Ice, Thunder

Resembling a bear with razor-sharp claws and aggressive behavior, the common Arzuros is no easy feat to battle due to its large size and extensive weaponry, which makes it dangerous. Its Apex form is even more deadly, differing in appearance, with the monster having cuts all over its body and being gray/black compared to the yellow-tanned coloration of its counterpart.

This particular monster has intense rage and anger, throwing rocks at hunters, calling large swarms of beasts to attack, and even stealing honey from unexpected victims.

5 Apex Rathalos

Rage-Fueled Aerial Destruction

Monster Class

Elements

Weakness

Flying Wyvern

Fire

Dragon, Thunder

The famed Rathalos got a new form in Monster Hunter: Rise to add to its countless other variants. Apex Rathalos is a Rathalos on steroids, with more powerful attacks and larger fireballs.

Much like Apex Azuros, it can call on other monsters for aid and is far more extreme than its usual variation, bringing fireballs down from the sky to defeat hunters who dare challenge it. With wounds all over its body, Apex Rathalos is fueled by rage, pain, and anger - making it a powerful foe.

4 Apex Rathian

Enhanced Venomous Power And Ferocity

Monster Class

Elements

Weakness

Flying Wyvern

Fire

Dragon, Thunder

While Rathalos and Rathians are often tied in terms of power, the Rathian usually comes out on top due to its highly toxic barbs. Apex Rathian doubles down on its venom capabilities, shooting spines at hunters in a flurry of deadly proportions.

Stronger than most Rathian variants, Apex Rathian is one of the game's toughest Apex monsters and flying leviathans. Apex Rathian comes in just below Apex Diablos in terms of power due to lacking the raw brute strength of its Leviathan peer.

3 Apex Diablos

Supreme Desert Predator

Monster Class

Elements

Weakness

Flying Wyvern

None

None

The Diablos are among the strongest flying leviathans in the Monster Hunter games. Known for being the king of the desert, traveling the dusty depths of sand to attack hunters, Diablos is highly aggressive, with massive protruding horns used to charge at hunters and dig underground.

The Apex Diablos features even larger thorns with stronger powers, faster, more frequent attacks, and constant aggression, making the fight one of the hardest in Monster Hunter: Rise. The creature also has stronger movesets using roars in conjunction with explosive charging.

2 Apex Mizutsune

Graceful Yet Deadly Foe

Monster Class

Elements

Weakness

Leviathan

Water

Thunder, Dragon, Ice

Mizutsune is an elegant leviathan that controls bubbles to immobilize preying hunters. The beast also attacks in dance-like moves, with considerable skill in the heat of battle. This graceful creature in Apex form is transformed into a beast with unmatched aggression and power, using hellfire in its bubbles to attack hunters.

Apex Mizutsune also has a larger tail and is far more terrifying and powerful than its other variants, rivaling but not beating Apex Zigore, which comes top of this list.

1 Apex Zinogre

Unmatched Apex Monster Supremacy

Monster Class

Elements

Weakness

Fanged Wyvern

Thunder

Ice, Water, Dragon, Fire

Apex Zinogre is the king of all Apex Monsters. An incredibly strong variant of the fanged electric wyvern known as Zinogre, its apex form pushes its electrical prowess to the next level with an abundance of new electric moves, such as creating massive lightning strikes using thunder bugs.

This far more aggressive and powerful version is said to rival the strength of elder dragons, making it easily the strongest Apex Monster on this list. Apex Zinogre is one of the most powerful beasts in Monster Hunter: Rise.
